intro: Eleocharis retroflexa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spike-rush, is a grass-like plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and other moist environments, making it an important component of aquatic and riparian ecosystems. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly rough texture, and it produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Eleocharis retroflexa plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
